5.heading: Thaca Reem.
5.title: "Desert Shadows" 10 p. in Wet Dreams
5.author: Alfonso Azpiri (Rockville Centre, NY : Heavy Metal, 2000) ; and in Heavy Metal, v
notes: Summary: Sultan Ahmed-Shah confines his beautiful daughter, Thaca Reem, to the palace while waiting for a suitable husband to come along. The princess is lonely, and consults a black magician about getting some company. The magician manages to conjure Thaca Reem's lost lover, Ali, but he can only stay by sharing her with his forty accomplices.

52.heading: Thalissar.
52.title: "Sinkha"
52.author: by Marco Patrito and Virtual Views, S
52.appears_in: N.C., and Strata, Inc., dba Mojave. p. 50-112 in Heavy Metal Special ; v. 10, no. 2 (Fall 1996).
notes: Summary: Hyleyn, a girl born in the city of Thalissar on the planet Ogon, wants to leave and see the universe. She gets herself taken aboard the Sinkha spaceship Darcron. At the same time both the humans and the Sinkha make disturbing discoveries about the nature of Thalissar: it was not built as a city by humans, but rather found and moved into a thousand years earlier. Thalissar is inhabited by a sleeping monster called Kahaltar. Kahaltar can tamper with the reality others perceive in order to protect itself, and uses Hyleyn as a human shield. The monster is defeated, but Hyleyn nearly dies and will need a new body generated for her.

notes: Summary: Zonker wins the tanning award, and thanks George Hamilton and all the little people who've supported him. Mark and B.D. don't particularly like being called little people.

106.heading: Thanks.
106.title: "It Can't Always Be About Bread Crumbs"
106.author: Wimmer.
notes: Summary: Rose thanks songbirds for a concert.

107.heading: Thanks.
107.title: "Never Take a Woman or Her Grip Strength for Granted"
107.author: D&R.
notes: Summary: Roger thanks Betty and shakes her hand, and ends up moaning.

108.heading: Thanks.
108.title: "Not Quite so Excruciatingly Boring, Anyway!"
108.author: Kevin Fagan.
notes: Summary: Norman thanks Wendy for her "ringing endorsement."

109.heading: Thanks.
109.title: "Raising Me Must've Cost You Serious Money Over the Years"
109.author: Templeton & Forman.
notes: Summary: A young man thanks his parents.

110.heading: Thanks.
110.title: "Something Very Special In Mind"
110.author: by Bill Amend.
notes: Summary: The girls are surprised that Jason and Marcus actually came, after all their pranks, and they plan to thank them for the trust; the boys run away.
Key word: Flashlights, unbelievable.

111.heading: Thanks.
111.title: "Sorry, But I'm Shooting for a Perfect Day of Ingratitude!"
111.author: Pat Brady.
notes: Summary: Clem doesn't thank Rose for a glass of milk.

112.heading: Thanks.
112.title: "There's a Twenty-Dollar Bill Lying on the Table!"
112.author: B
notes: Summary: They're supposed to bow their heads and close their eyes to give thanks, but they won't close their eyes.

113.heading: Thanks.
113.title: "Wink, Thank You So Much For Watching Stucco For Me"
113.author: by Rob Harrell.
notes: Summary: A bear is sitting on a clown.

114.heading: Thanks.
114.title: "Yes I Can"
114.author: Mike Peters.
notes: Summary: Miz Goose brings dinner, and Grimmy thinks he can't thank her enough, but then he smells it.

116.title: "Thanks Babe, I Don't Know What I'd Done Without You"
116.author: Drew Curtis
116.appears_in: p. 192-193 in Legal Action Comics. v. 1 (New York : Dirty Danny Legal Defense Fund, 2001).

118.title: Thanks, Carl!
118.author: Übersetzung der Comics, Erika Fuchs ; Chef redaktion und verantwortlich für diese Ausgabe, Michael F
notes: An homage to Carl Barks. Includes a number of his Donald Duck cartoon strips, and original works, tributes to Carl Barks, by 27 other artists.
"In memoriam 1901-2000."

119.title: "Thanks For Not Saying Anything Bad About Her Cooking"
119.author: Mell Lazarus.
notes: Summary: Momma leaves after Tina's meal, saying she can't talk on an upset stomach.

120.heading: Thanks for Nothing.
120.title: "Here's to You Pop, Thanks for Nothing!"
120.author: Wilson & Nolan.
notes: Summary: Dana drinks vodka in the ladies' room before her father's funeral.

121.title: "Thanks for Sparing Me the Details!"
121.author: O
notes: Summary: Cliff's back from the computer show and knows how to fix their computer, but is not talkative.
